description:
5 stars for the employees -- they were all friendly and fairly efficient.

1 star for the wait -- I've never been in here and not seen a line a mile long...nor have I ever gotten a drink ordered and made in under 20 minutes.

The interior is pretty cool, but the wait times are brutal.

Come to this Starbucks if you have time to kill (think: lazy day coffee break with a friend), otherwise pick a different one if you're looking to be in and out.
author: Nic Z.

description:
It's 5:30 in the morning. The only thing on your mind is coffee so you can get your mind to work properly again. Fortunately for me, this Starbucks made that experience smooth and easy. The icing on the cake was a friendly barista (your hair was looking great, girl!) who started my day off right. My only regret is not asking her name for this review! 

Not being a lover of strong coffee tasting drinks, I went with a chai tea latte. Paired with a croissant it was the perfect mild caffeine and food combination to get me started. The place was empty save for one other customer frantically typing on a laptop in a far corner. Yet another weird observation from the naked city...

Who knows how this place may change once the rest of the world wakes up. I just know it was a smooth experience for me!
author: Alex L.

description:
This happens to be my favorite Starbucks in San Francisco mainly because it is connected to the Sir Francis Drake hotel. The service at this location, overall is very very good! I especially love when "Liz" is working as she's a real sweetheart and has been working there I'd say, at least, eight years. It's always great catching up with her.

The only reason why I give this location four stars, instead of five, is due to the influx of homeless constantly streaming in and out, demanding patrons give them money. The real kicker is how the homeless steals tips from the tip jar which are monies the baristas (employees) need to pay their high rent in San Francisco. I was told (at another Starbucks location) that the employees are automatically taxed based on earning $1 per hour in tips no matter what. So if the tips are stolen, they are still taxed on their paycheck. I do not like how the homeless who steal are given more flexibility than the employees.

But all that aside, I still love getting drinks from this Starbucks location. The employees do a great job!
author: Peter C.

description:
I noticed the crowd here is very touristy, especially because it is close to tourist locations: the cable car stop, Union Square, Westfield Mall, Chinatown, etc. I've noticed that the line ebbs and flows: sometimes it gets to be very long, and sometimes there are only 1-2 people.. but there is never a down time. The people at the cashier also take awhile taking orders and making drinks, so the line moves slowly and it takes awhile getting drinks.

That being said, I like that the Starbucks is conveniently located. It is pretty standard for a Starbucks, with standard drinks. Nothing that special. I've gotten mixed services: some of the baristas/cashiers are not very friendly, but a few of them are patient and nice, especially as I'm trying to find my starbucks gift card or coupon. 

Recently, I've had some trouble activating my Starbucks coupons. I went three times trying to figure out a "buy one get one free" coupon I had on my Starbucks app. The first time, they told me I had to buy a drink first and come back later with the receipt to get a drink (which it didn't say in the app). The second time I came with the receipt, the Starbucks code in my app for the BOGO drink didn't work. Finally, the third time I came in, it worked. Don't know what it was. BUT, that third time, the cashier not only gave us the free drink, but also gave us another drink! That made up for some of the less positive experiences that I had there, and makes me more likely to go back.
author: Julianna K.

description:
Probably one of the worst Starbucks location I've ever been to. I come here occasionally when I shop downtown, but I feel like all the baristas/cashiers have some kind of attitude problem. I get it, it's the Union Square location and it's probably busy all day, but they seriously look like they hate their jobs. I was the next person in line, and after the cashier finished taking the order of the person in front of me, they called "Next" and then just blankly stared at me. No "What can i get for you?" or whatever other Starbucks workers (at all other locations I've been to) say. I don't expect you to be overly friendly or start a full on conversation with me but the vibe I was getting from the cashier was just rude. It's pretty basic customer service...this happens almost every time I'm here. 

I ordered an iced soy matcha latte and when I got it, it was barely mixed and I could both taste and see all the unblended matcha powder at the bottom. It made my drink bitter with all the matcha powder at the bottom and the top just tasted like straight soy milk. I asked the barista if they could blend my drink some more and the guy kind of just looked at me and then stared at my drink. After a couple seconds he offered to pour my drink into a different cup without all the powder at the bottom. Um, not what I asked for and it defeats the purpose of a 'matcha latte' if all the matcha at the bottom is thrown out. But I didn't want to be any more difficult so I just took the new cup.

If you can hold off on your Starbucks craving, I would skip this location and walk a few more blocks to the next closest one.
author: Cecille W.

description:
Today it was smashed and the crew deserves a huge kudos! The crew worked in tandem and the Barista just kept jamming on making all those drinks. My drink is a flat white, and many baristas don't like to make it. Well, this guy for all the speed he was putting in, made it very good. I've seen (bet you have also) they just pour it in, cap it and done. But this guy was super good. He needs a raise $$!.
Answering questions from his crew and still on point was awesome.
When he had to redo a drink, no problem he just did it! 
Hope he reads this as he deserves a great pat on the back for a job well done. Raise GM, give him one.
author: Tyler C.

description: It's a Starbucks coffee. The service is great. I order my drink; they give it to me right away. It is Starbucks coffee though and doesn't taste that great so I can't give them 5 stars. I knew this going in there so I can't really knock them too much for having sub-par coffee when it's all they serve.
author: Nico M.

description: I had the worst customer service in this starbucks location. When I ordered my latte the cashier DIANNA, didnt even smile, cranky took my order. Take note, she was leaning on her pos system and litterally rolling her eyebrows on me. Totally unacceptable, from a paying customer this totally the worst experience ever. Pull out your camera todays date 7/12 - 3:25 pm to 3:40 pm.
author: Joshua B.

description: Same Starbucks experience, but slow beyond imagination. 20 min for 3 coffees is too long.
author: Clement H.

description:
I come here a few times a week, and it's a great Starbucks. But the quality of their croissants has fallen sharply in the past couple weeks. It's just depressing.

Other than that, save for one employee, the staff is awesome.
author: Jordan S.

description:
I think if I act like I am a homeless. That Asian (Philipino maybe) guy who works here today Sunday,18th June 2017 would throw me out from the shop and yell at me. He is such a rude and racist worker !!! 
BAD!!!!! I wish the manager see my message and talk to him.
author: Bankii I.

description:
So I headed to this Starbucks briefly while waiting for an appointment in the city, and it was pretty standard as Starbucks are concerned. I grabbed a wrap and some iced coffee.

One thing to note about this particular location is that it's pretty busy around the lunch hour. There was a line the entire time I was there, and it's difficult to grab a seat. Lastly, I wasn't able to access WiFi while I was here, which seemed odd for a Starbucks. Not sure if that's normal for this location or not.
author: Chet A.

description: Standard Starbucks to get your caffeine fix, very courteous staff. Assembly line of order and get your coffee, clean store and convenient since I'm staying at the Kimpton above it.
author: Ramon A.

description: My friend and I were at this location earlier this afternoon. As flu and cold continues to spread out across the country. One of the employee that works at this location came out from the "kitchen/back office" and blew his nose in front of many customers. My friend and I were stunned of how could he decided to blow his nose in front of many people. Few seconds later without washing his hands he took over for another barista. Some customers were looking at him and we were all looking at each other. It was extremely disgusting what he did and I don't think I would and other customer who saw him would come back to this location. Please speak to your employees about washing their hands. What he did was really gross.
author: Emma Yna B.

description: I spend a lot of time getting coffee and breakfast at this Starbucks. It's right next to my hotel and I'm in dire need when I'm in SF for work. They never mess up my order and from line up to pick up it's 15 minutes. I'll live, and they've made me not hangry in the morning. What else can you ask for? ENJOY!
author: Darlene Y.

description:
5/27/2016:
This is actually a very nice location for a Starbucks. The Barista Team Members are very friendly. I came in right after a workout session at the gym. Strawberries & Creme Frappuccino is one tasty beverage. Also, the service is prompt and courteous. Overall, positive first experience here.

Reasons for rating:
- friendly team members
- location is easy to find
- prompt, courteous service
- Powell St Cable Car Lines stop right in front
Hungry or thirsty while waiting for the cable car? Starbucks got you covered with the food and beverages for the refreshers.
author: Bennett W.

description: Busy and dirty. Long waits for coffee. On a happier note, the times I've been here my orders have been accurate.
author: Romeo A.

description:
Sadly, I go to this Starbucks two to three times a day because it is so close to my work.
I always order the same coffee, it's programmed into my app.
It's never the same twice.
Today, I just dropped it into the garbage on my way out, it was awful and they tried to fix it, instead of starting over. It was vomit in a cup.
I pay $6.35 every time I order coffee.
So, Starbucks, What-The-Fuck?

So sad I can't leave a negative star review...

11/14/16 Yet another shitty coffee for $6.35. You'd think for $15 an hour they could hire people smart enough to make a cup of coffee, but, nope...

12/28/16  I really don't understand how this store can make such a shit-tasting cup of coffee.  My order is printed by the machine, so there isn't human error on the ordering side. If the barista can't follow simple instructions, they need to go. It's coffee, not rocket science.
author: Timothy F.

description:
It's Starbucks. They're basically all the same, yes? 
Caffeine, and the well oiled machine that are the baristas turn those drinks out like a rehearsed dance production. BAM! Jazz hands!!!
author: Danielle G.

description: I've always loved Starbucks until I came in today and the prices gone up . They boosted up the tea prices, as if they weren't already charging an arm  and a leg ! I will not be buying tea from Starbucks anymore . They are greedy and their stuff is watered down compared to petes coffee . So long Starbucks !
author: Sasha F.

description:
I finally decided to give this Starbucks a review after 3 experiences of horrible customer service. 

1. I ordered a plain hot chocolate. When I received it, it was so watered down I couldn't even tell it was hot chocolate. When I told the barista this, she told me that's impossible and continued on with the other orders.

2. I was IDed for using my DEBIT CARD. I have never been IDed once in my life when using my debit card when using my pin. When I explained this to her, she rolled her eyes and proceeded to refuse to help me with my order unless I showed ID.

3. As I was ordering, the cashier kept rolling her eyes as I asked ordered my drink. I didn't pay much attention to it until as She was handing me my change she dropped it on the table almost as if on purpose when my hand was out to take the change. Usually cashiers just place the money on the table but she literally dropped it onto the counter. I don't know what her problem is but these workers have the worst customer service. I work a block away and as much as I love Starbucks I will never come here again.
author: Kellan M.

description: They don't have a single public electrical outlet to charge a phone. Which is, frankly, why I go into Starbucks and spend money as I travel. They also forgot to make my drink and had me standing around for 15 minutes waiting for a drink that never came, and then they finally remade it. Finally, they started packing up the pastries at 6:30pm...despite being open until 11. I'm never coming back to this location. Ever.
author: Jack P.

description:
Waiting to much for coffee and cookie.
Once I've got the coffee, it wasn't like I was ordered.
I expected more.. not to mention the price is way too high.
author: Adir D.

description: The Best Starbucks Cafe ever! The staff, especially Victoria and Costello, are super nice and fast! These guys are pro's!
author: Everette R.

description: Ok so the reason of my review is because of the Asian lady cashier thrusday 4pm . He told the barista to make 2 drinks at the same time in a very rude way. I felt sorry for the guy. Anyway if she is the manager. Let get her some management classes before talking to coworkers like that .
author: Simon B.

description: This is the worst Starbucks I have ever been to. First they didn't have mini size, so I ordered a tall DCC frap. When I got my drink they stuck a tall cup in a grande and put a lid on it. The lid did not stay on at all. Also, I swear this has coffee in it. The girl says it has no coffee in it, but even my husband can tell it does and he hates coffee. I'm pregnant I can't have caffeine so I think I'm going to just throw it away. My husband ordered a hot chocolate and he threw his away because it tasted like warm milk. Horrible service. I have attached the pic of my cup so you can see the quality of service this fine establishment has. These people need some training.
author: Nicole R.

description: There was a super long line on a typical, cold, dreary summer Sunday in a heavy tourist area but the staff impressively flew through the orders quickly and efficiently. I've seen less crowded Starbucks take longer to get my coffee and breakfast sandwich.
author: Robyn P.

description: Great, only the guy who looks like an intern was working. Others, no one was working, chatting all the time! I waited 10 mints for a coffee!
author: Qiu J.

description: My gf and I are visiting from the SoCal area and are staying at Powell Place up the street from this StarBucks. The staff is very friendly, especially Elia! She is the sweetest! Pretty busy in the morning like any mother typical Starbucks. Very well kept, sleek and cool.
author: Keith F.

description: The worst customer service I have ever seen. This location has a lot of tourists that take a little more time and help. They couldn't care less. I go to Starbucks at least 4 times a week this one is really nice if you get rid of the people that work there. I didn't even get a Hi or good morning just what do you want. The lady was in a bad mood I guess but should not be helping customers with her attitude and I watched her treat everyone the same. At least the coffee was good.
author: Art S.

description: I come here everyday. I usually order through the app for pick up. Today at 1245pm I decided to go in to use my reward. I asked for a trenta green ice tea. I got my order and it was missing 2.5 inches of liquid aka a venti basically. I asked the barista to fill my cup. Of course she gave me attitude. She did fill my cup up so thanks for that. Wouldn't have been a big deal if she would of made eye contact with me or even apologized. I will probably just go to the other Starbucks down the block. Thanks for the amazing customer service here.
author: Lea B.

description:
This Starbucks is charming I love the black, gold, & green colours. It is warm and inviting, cheery and comfy, reminds me more of a British Pub, than a coffee shop. The cases are also filled with pastries which look enticing. The Staff are Polite, keen, and coffee savvy. I got great service in particular by a Barista named Ron. He was friendly,  fast, precise, and delivered a perfect bevvy.

This Starbucks is touristy, classy, and unique!
author: Julian I.

description: This Starbucks is always busy doesn't matter the day or time. If you're in a rush the best thing to do is use your app and order a drink. Great location and easy to get too
author: Jennie K.

description:
Ordered a iced latte and the minute I picked it up the lid was defective and it leaked onto my pants. Just great, but thats not my beef, the color of my iced latte was almost white, literally, as if I just paid for a cup of milk. I've had this happen before and was told some lame excuse that their expresso shots are more concentrated but this isnt my first time buying a latte. The barista realized there were no coffee beans in the machine, but thats another incident.

I literally buy iced lattes every fucken day for the last 8 years. Anyways point being I know how my fucking latte should taste. I go back to the barista and ask him to remake it and told him its all milk and lacking expresso. So he remakes it and its the same fucking drink, milky. Either their machine is fucked up or they need to refill the coffee beans. I mentioned it was milky again and the barista then went on and tried to educate me that a tall iced latte is milk and 1 shot. Great thanks for letting me know you know how to complete your remedial task of pouring a cup of milk, pushing a button for the shot of expresso and adding ice. So he then said he can add another shot of expresso. So after he adds the shot he announces the drink double shot iced latte and adds for the third time. Then proceeds to ask if everything is ok with my drink.

Ok you fucking douche. Before I go ballistic and talk to your manager I look over and see my son waiting and decide to let it go. The asian barista man child with a big chip on his shoulder can continue being a douche.
author: Ken Y.

description:
This Starbucks, one of many located in/around Union Square, is located on the ground level of the Sir Francis Drake Hotel.  At the corner of Powell St. and Sutter St, it's across Powell from Walgreen's and across Sutter from the Marriott.

We stopped by on a Monday around 8:30am.  The coffee shop was packed.  The customers were a mixture of hotel guests, tourists, and locals.  One haggard-looking individual (he appeared to be homeless) set up shop at a small table near the entrance and spent his time painting with watercolors.

Indoor and outdoor (sidewalk) seating are available.

We grabbed a slice of Iced Lemon Pound Cake and a Morning Bun for breakfast and sat inside at the counter facing Sutter St. people watching.  Almost every seat in the store was taken.

Shortly after posting the photo of the Iced Lemon Pound Cake on Yelp, Kevin C. sent me a compliment saying I'd be surprised at the nutrition facts behind it.  I wasn't surprised because it was one extremely rich, moist, and delicious cake.  Emphasis on delicious.  One slice is 490 calories, which includes 130mg (43% daily value) of cholesterol.

The Morning Bun wasn't as tasty as the Iced Lemon Pound Cake, but still good.  The Morning Bun is like a big croissant/muffin variant topped with sugar and cinnamon.  Physically bigger than the pound cake, it's only 350 calories.  I'm not sure if I'd ever order the Morning Bun again, but you can bet your bottom dollar I will be eating more Iced Lemon Pound Cakes in the future... and I'm not even a fan of lemon in cakes.

Service was satisfactory.

There's only one restroom in this joint and if the store is busy, it'll almost always be taken.
author: Daniel B.

description: Typical Starbucks- great location. Although it appears people around SF are not accustomed to people saying good morning. The staff seemed stressed so early in the morning. That is too bad. But I'll be back all week since it is located across the street from the Marriott.  I'll get a smile from one of them before I leave.
author: H R.

description: The entire store smells like disgusting bathroom and baristas are super lazy, talking to each other when they should be busy, also the trainee does nothing. Everyone is waiting for their coffee 10+ min, staring at them 'what are you doing stop talking and do your job'
author: Jennifer Z.

description:
Decent fast service
My issue is with the drinks everyone knows the markup is high on everything at Starbucks but my issue is that when you order iced tea they add water to it without even asking....its iced tea the ice will melt and cut out the bitterness no need for more water in an already overpriced drink
author: Kelly A.

description: What a complete ass Ramon was. Said hello to him and he just stared at me. Kid needs an attitude adjustment.
author: Bart V.

description:
Stopped by this location while I stayed at the Sir Francis Drake Hotel and the service was pretty bad. My breakfast sandwich was cold and the restrooms were gross ( refer to picture) . 

I would definitely stop somewhere else, employees seemed extremely disgruntled here.
author: Evelyn H.

description: i love this location! I'm here every morning picking up my breakfast and coffee and because of that the employees greet me by name and always have my stuff ready to go (mobile ordering) this place gets pretty busy since its right in front of the Marriott and in front of the cable car stop.
author: Carina P.

description: Very quick and helpful morning staff. This is a busy spot and I was glad to get in and out within 10 minutes with a very long line. The staff was nice and quick to move the line along.
author: Isabel S.

description:
Loud and hip starbucks for sure. I can tell this is a business oriented based on the quick response from the barista not even letting my finish my sentance. 

Orders get taken and are quickly pressed out, no complaints here I just always look at my local startbucks baristas as friendly and chatty.
author: Candace C.

description: Maybe bc it's a tourist Starbucks catered for them that as a local I felt the customer service was horrible. Although it should be even more on point since they are catering to tourist. Between the person who took my order who looked frustrated and upset already and the guy who threw my turkey bacon sandwich on the counter I sure felt they were angry. So sad to experience such poor service.
author: Cristina P.

description:
I seem to have forgotten to actually publish this review after writing it. However, my experience was so remarkably bad I'd like to share it to save others a repeat.

I came in a little after 10pm on Tuesday 7/15/14. There was no line so I thought, "Great this will be fast."

I don't expect great late night service but I wasn't expecting service to be this bad. I came in. The place wasn't that busy and was fairly quiet, or at least no louder than any other Starbucks.

Despite polite "Hello, I'm ready to order!" looks and the occasionally, "Um, hi there?" I got ignored by the dude rearranging pastries in the pastry case. Yes he saw me but, okay fine, whatever.

So finally I'm standing in from of an barista at the cash register, a paunchy white dude with dark brown hair. I'm thinking, "Great, there's no way he doesn't see me. It's so obvious there's no way for him to ignore me."

Me: Hi there! Um, can I please get a caramel frappachino? 
Him: *ignores me*
Me: "Hi! Nice evening! Can I please get a caramel frappachino?"
Him: *Looks at me and does nothing*
Me: I'd like a caramel frappuchino, please.
Him [and I quote directly]: "Are you talking? Because I see your mouth moving but you aren't speaking."
Me [projecting my voice as if for theatre]: I'd like a caramel frappachino, please! 
Him: Are you speaking English?
Me [to my light skinned Native/Mexican/Nordic American California born native English speaking self in my head]: "No, i'm speaking faux-Italian off your company's internationally standardized menu, you racist brick brained prick!" 
Me [what I actually say, loudly]: I said, I would like a frappuchino, please.
Him [rudely]: Can you say that louder?
Me [what I want to say]: Actually, no.
Me [what I actually say]: i have a sore throat. (I don't want to explain hormone or other medical stuff. It's more info than I normally give to a barista and plus, racism is enough, I'd rather continue to assume he's not also treating me this way because he's transphobic or transmysogynistic.)
Him; ......
Me: *repeats order again, this time softer to disguise the fact i'm seething with anger*

After all this, he suddenly (and finally acts) like he understands asks size. At this point I don't know whether to say "grande" or medium since he might be a douche about the English thing if i say "grande" but is the sort of person you could totally see going "we don't have a grande on the menu" I say "grande" and we go through the same racist s**t all over again except this time faster.

He makes some comments about how "tough" it is that i'm sick and that he hopes i feel better. it's one thing to talk with a flat affect and/or not to care but it's a whole different thing to manage to say that sort of thing in a way that actually manages to sound mean and sarcastic.
author: A J.

description: Fast service considering how busy it was during the times i went there. It's conveniently located across from the Marriott hotel and 24hrs Walgreens. It would be nice if they had a bigger sitting area since its busy most of the time.
author: Pri D.

description: Wifi is fast and reliable and you can get discounts and discontinued drinks like the unicorn frappe!!!! All in all it's very good!!!!
author: John Y.

description: If they're not too busy joking around with each other, one of the staff might help YOU, the one with the money in your hand. But don't expect them to be friendly or quick about it.
author: Anita B.

description: To the barista named Edwin, you are an asshole.. Thank you very much for giving my visitor from another state the unforgettable  & disgusting attitude after we just paid for your salary!.. if your not in the mood then effin stay in the storage area! if your not feeling well then call and sick! Or If u hate gays that much then move out of SFO!
author: Kris E.

description: Really the worst Starbucks bathroom in San Fran. Upper management on site and this is the only restroom? This is a constant issue for this location as I see earlier photos of nasty restroom posted. Get it together folks!
author: D J.

description: Very convenient..just across the street from my hotel. They were pretty fast taking and getting my order. Only issue I had was the cashier did not listen to what my name was (so wrong on the cup) and she was grumpy.  People have bad days, but a hello or good morning goes a long way.
author: Dmarie B.

description:
Never get what I want. I oreded Strawverry refersher and they out all the time. So I tried order Mango black tea and they said we out of mango also. OK..... then week later I order the new frappucino "Mocha coconut Frappucino" I got it and it really good with the toasted coconut chips. BUT!!!!! this week I oredered it again and I got Mocha with coconut milk...... whyyyyyy I think all staff should know what all their recipe if you want to sell the coffee!!! 

A few weeks before I got the weird birthday frappucin0 without pink whipcream and the staff said he dont know how to make it...
author: Orange S.

description: It's the first Starbucks if you come down from Nob Hill so it's really busy in the morning. The crew there are not nice! Just not friendly at all. They should be used to tourist business and the place being busy almost all the time. But they are not! I witnessed a man asking if his two drinks were ready and was told in quite a condescending way 'there are two right there!!!!!'
author: Eve M.

description: This was a nice cozy Starbucks located in union square. I really liked how spacious it was since my friend and I were easily able to find a seat amidst a busy crowd. However, if you plan on using their bathroom, beware. Many people are thinking the same thing as you're thinking when they walk in to the store - "Finally! A public bathroom!". But the one at the Starbucks is not clean and always has a long wait (longer than the line to get coffee!)
author: Rachel L.

description:
I've really started to despise Starschmux. But now, the gloves are off.

Our hotel had a Starbucks attached to it, and after having just woken up in the Pacific time zone, I needed a jolt. Mind you, I was totally lucid - just mainly stupid for breaking my rule.

First off: why do I have this rule? Because Starbucks has gotten to big to succeed. With a few notable exceptions where baristas and other workers are well-trained, I leave these places feeling like an idiot-sucker dumb-ass, desperate for a quick jolt of java.

So I approach the counter, and I could already tell the vibe in the place was not good. (Other Yelpers like Kimberly S. have cited the service, so I concur with them - but I hadn't read those reviews before going in.)

I asked for a Cafe Americano and a Latte. The barista snuck up behind the cashier and started to confirm my order while the cashier was still talking to me. They were literally talking over each other. I put up my hands and said, "wait, one at a time please." I thought that was a reasonable and even a little bit funny thing to say.

That didn't go over well. After I reconfirmed my order, the cashier handed my change to me - and I'm quoting - "Maybe your latte will wake you up a little."

What I wanted to say was GFY lady, but I didn't. I just waited for my coffee and headed back to my hotel room.

What these chains don't understand is that one bad apple spoils the bunch. It's Dancing Goats for me from now on.
author: Will P.

description: Music very offensive. The f*** word used every other word, as well as the s*** word. Ridiculous. This is a public coffee shop, kids come in here all the time. Put some Christmas music on for crying out loud.
author: April M.

description:
The barista forgot all about customer service on his hurry to make drinks. He pretty much spilled all my ice coffee while putting on the lid, and didn't say sorry or tried to wipe off the stickiness. 

On a brighter note, I love the new decor. There is a big table in the middle with high bar stools in conjunction with the ones alongside the windows.
author: Mily W.

description:
Bring your own towel. The blended-drinks are so sloppily made you'll have to wipe off the sides before carrying it. 

3/10, will not recommend guests to visit.
author: Cody R.

description:
Busy location corner of Powell and Sutter, you know me and the Starbucks brand, I have a love hate relationship with this company.  Love the fact I can rely on wifi and a bathroom when visiting a city, although you may have to wait for the bathroom.

This location is busy, very and you may find a homeless person or two making their temporary home here as well.  I'm all for a warm seat but I'm sad to see this happen, I'd rather see Starbuck's fund our own issues in our own countries than overseas, or at least address the issues at home.

Now that I have that off my chest, I am a big fan of the 'BUCKS' because of their loyalty program, their reliable wifi and generally speaking, clean bathrooms.
author: Denni P.

description: I went in and I met the friendliest baristas ever! Made my Wednesday night thank you to the two super awesome baristas
author: Honai S.

description: Cheerful, no hassle service. I appreciate the speed and accuracy with which they took my order and presented my breakfast order with a smile.
author: Eva L.

description:
This used to be Cafe Espresso a few years ago...

Starbucks bought this prime spot.
It is on the corner of Powell and Sutter Streets.

It's your standard Starbucks, 
with the standard Starbuck coffee and tea drinks.

It has indoor and outdoor seating.
Although I feel that this place could put more tables and chairs inside.

Let's pack them in!
author: Derek N.

description: My morning and my coffee was right here. During my vacation in San Francisco, this Starbucks was part of my morning. I will always remember my mocha frappuccino !
author: Darko G.

description: Efficient, friendly service on a busy morning! Much more pleasant ambiance than the location just down Sutter.
author: Stefan V.

description:
Thank you for remembering my order!　
I don't know his name, but always nice customer service.
author: Ria D.

description:
This is my favorite Starbucks anywhere. manager is Great. the Baristas are so hard working, I have seen them Crank'em out by the dozens, they work really fast. Always friendly. what more could you ask for a coffee joint?
They work Like a machine
author: August S.

description: Not one of my favorite Starbucks, it's always full, too full! Service here is bad. They're rude so if you don't get in line they won't acknowledge you, I wasn't able to distinguish the line since it was full. After finally waiting in a so called line, I was told to wait elsewhere and not in front of the line. I was confused about where to wait since there was barely any space. I walked around squeezing through people until finally a couple left and I was able to settle down. The tables were messy, wet and had trash all over the table and floor. My drink took forever to make. After a long wait I saw that a venti strawberries and cream frappuccino was there I assumed it was mine since nobody else was grabbing it. Oh well I ended up returning since a friend wanted to stop by for a frappuccino. We had the same experience. Therefore thumbs down. Great drink though but bad customer service.
author: Juan C.

description: This particular Starbucks really sucks. I waited like 15-20 mins just for tall chai latte. They all looked like being stoned and were very slow.
author: Murgatroid S.

description: Amazing Starbucks! They have WiFi and on a weekend morning you can bring your laptop and work - did not notice much crowd during weekend mornings and early afternoons. I usually go for their Lemon Rose herbal tea latte. Love the customer service as well. They make your tea/coffee pretty fast. Other starbucks I have seen are slower compared to this one. Always love going to this one!
author: Sun B.

description: Hot coffee.  Long line but fast and friendly service. We arrived at peak morning coffee hour but the staff was friendly and upbeat.  The inside was clean and organized well for a busy city coffee shop.
author: Beth R.

description:
I like this particular Starbucks a lot. We come here each time we're in SF (live in San Diego). I've heard it's the second busiest Starbucks in the city, yet they handle the (sometimes endless) lines quickly and efficiently. Unlike a few of the reviews I've read, I have never encountered an "attitude" among the employees. I believe you get what you give. If you go in with a smile, that's what you'll get. If you go in and demonstrate your stress or impatience, you may well get it back, too, because I'd say they have a pretty stressful, busy job, as well. 
To get 5 stars from me, I'd like to see just a few more seats inside.
author: Karen F.

description:
I wouldn't rate a Starbucks, I mean it's pretty standard. And I visit Starbucks often. This one happens to be on my way to office. Morning times very busy, I understand. But asking for a grande and then having my drink only 3/4 of cup size is VERY disappointing.
I was in hurry, and pretty sure most of the people in the morning are. They just wanna get their drink and head off to work. Who wants to wait and argue about drink quantity and delay others during peak work times?

But having to pay for grande size and instead getting a tall drink in grande cup is a scam. I am sure I'm not the first one experiencing this. Scam, cheat, robbery are the words coming to my mind.
author: Nikhil S.

description:
Me and my friend stopped in this Starbucks to get a drink before walking to Chinatown. The line was long but moved fairly quickly which was ok. My friend ordered a Latte and I ordered a black tea lemonade.

My black tea lemonade was good as usual. The latte my friend ordered was not made right. It was not hot, and not filled enough. It was almost like it was half full or someone drank from it. It also tasted burnt. The guy making drinks was nice enough to remake the drink. I would have given more stars if not for that. 

In the end though, both drinks did taste good. Just had to wait double as long because we had to wait for the person to remake the latte.
author: Katherine L.

description: My coffee came watery and I wished that it wasn't. But, thanks to Starbucks for hiring a kind employee, I was able to get another stronger (not watery) dark roast along with a cheese pastry. I liked the architecture and color palette of it. But, overall a good experience.
author: Sydney P.

description:
This Starbucks is near the office, so I swing by here every now and then. I have to say the folks here are really nice. It's so close to Union Square so it gets kinda packed. The employees are really patient, and are always in a great mood. 

There are 3 things that I feel could be improved: 
1.) There is always this lady out in the front asking for 75cents all day in the door. 
2.) There are pallets out on the floor for restock during business hours..not to safe when you're on the pick up side for coffee. 
3.) This place should be open longer!
author: Marie P.

description:
Ugh - I won't review the coffee because, we'll, have one Starbucks and you've had them all. But this place gets mention because its one of the busiest Starbucks locations I've ever been to outside of the original in Pike Place Market. 

Be prepared for a quick moving but long line in a sea of humanity.
author: Jake K.

description: Really crowded and not much space to sit. bathrooms aren't clean but they're also very busy most of the time. Service is good, everyone is fast and its usually all smiles so I guess its an OK place. BTW they give out these cute little mini frappes at the beginning of happy hour (3PM-5PM May1-May 10)
author: Vanessa O.

description:
No 8 grain roll! Nothing here for people who are diabetics and trying to follow a vegan lifestyle. They told me to get the multigrain bagel. They said it was good with cream cheese. I told him I'm a vegan, and they should have an 8 grain roll. He looked confused.

Also, super slow service. My wife ordered a venti chai. Took 10 minutes!!!
author: Joe C.

description: It's starbucks, they are all the same.  This one was packed, but the line moved fast.  They microwaved all of our pastries and scones which make them doughy.  I have never had a scone served steaming hot from microwave.  Not good.  Coffee was good.
author: T B.

description: Coffee tastes great. Tastes like every other Starbucks I have been to. As for the service.... I couldn't believe my eyes! Staff hollerin' at customers on the job.... On their phones the entire time..... Talking about inappropriate subjects on the job....and dropping F bombs like no other with children present! Horrible. I do know if Starbucks has training for this... But they need to take something to fix this.
author: Daniel S.

description:
Literally the hardest working Starbucks workers I have ever met. They work with all kinds of people, from homeless paying in scavenged change to business men who probably think a gallon of milk is about $40
.. and they do it with speed and (usually) smiles. I've been a regular here for about a year, as it is just south of my school, and I have seen my fair share of bravery from these baristas. They have helped people get their stolen bags back, provided excellent service, and protected us from some very scary people. Frankly, I expected to see much better reviews when I looked them up. Of course they make mistakes. There is a margin for human error, but isn't "human" supposed to be the whole idea behind Starbucks?

The team here is amazing. I imagine you can't last long with the intensity of the environment, though. The store is often a non-stop flow of foreigners, students, FiDi guys, and locals until about 1 or 2 in the afternoon. But even when they're packed, they manage to make your drink swiftly, and get you through the line. There are other Starbucks a block in either direction, but I can't imagine going to either of them.

Starbucks is a massive corporation, and the only thing that really makes a difference between them is the team, and this is one amazing team!
author: Jaclyn C.

description: Stopped here each morning my family was in San Francisco over the weekend. They open early and usually got in here around 6am. No lines, friendly staff, and quick service. They had PLENTY of food and options. Location was clean and good amount of seating for being in compact SF. Great location!
author: Justin E.

description: Like all Starbucks locations, this one is busy and I looks unclean. I feel 2 stars is generous since I found a strand of hair when I opened the lid of my oatmeal. Gross!!! Unfortunately, I had already left and didn't want to get in the crowd to go and return it. ...already lost my appetite at that point.
author: Jade E.

description: Located next to my hotel, perfect for picking up early morning/late afternoon coffee.
author: Virginia M.

description:
I've been to this place to mooch off of their wifi two days in a row now. The fake ginger taking orders is really friendly, and i guess thats what you need when there are a billion tourists and locals coming to this particular store. the chai tea latte is always da bomb; and what better to do than people watch while you're sitting down too. 
this Starbucks really captures the hustle and bustle of Union Square. 
Even though it may take a while longer because the line can get outrageous, hey did 40 extra seconds ever kill anyone?
author: Chelsea B.

description: Not a fan of your overpriced coffee in the first place. However out of all the Starbucks I have been to -This Starbucks sucks the most!!!!!!
author: Mike C.

description: I am a huge Starbucks drink buyer! Came to San Francisco for the first time since I was kid...wow has it changed! Left our hotel to grab a cup of coffee and got the worst service ever! So this Starbucks has a giant pillar in front of their cash register. When we walked in, we looked for a "line starts here sign" but didn't see one. So we waited by the register. Then like a minute later, the cashier looks up at us and tells us the line starts on the other side of the pillar...(which a line had then formed by then). We said "ok, but we had been here already before the line formed". Then another employee butt in and told us where the line starts. We again told her we know but had been there before the line started. Then, the cashier told us that next time we need to know that the line started on the other side of the pillar. The whole Starbucks was looking at us at this point. We felt so disrespected and embarrassed. The cashier should've let us order and told us in a nicer way about the line. What a way to end our last night here!
author: Bella J.

description: This was a cool Starbucks, and super busy, staff were friendly, and the coffee was made right, go buy something expensive at Union Square, then head here for a drinkarooskie....
author: Timothy C.

description: Good but crowded! No wonder they concentrate multiple Starbucks within a block of each other.
author: Aaron S.

description:
I have to be a fan considering I'm here at least twice a week, since I work nearby and love wasting my money on coffee!

Sometimes service is slow even when there is hardly anyone in there, hence the -1 star, those people can use some work. But most of the workers are nice and get things done quickly, especially for being a really busy Starbucks. The lines are horrible around 9am, when I want my coffee before work! So I have to come around 12 to avoid the tourists.
author: Kimberly L.

description: Less than one block away, on Stockton and Powell, is another Starbucks. I recommend going to that one. A good portion of the staff at this Starbucks is condescending, often messes up orders, and most recently spilled an entire latte on my cell phone, with no acknowledgement of what happened.
author: Lauren D.

description: It's Starbucks, they all come pretty standard...good coffee, convenient location downtown, friendly staff, well made drinks. I wish there would be a bit more room at this location to sit down inside but it's always packed. For as busy and packed as it gets, the service is excellent and orders are completed quickly. I like this location overall, just would be nice if there was room for more seating indoors.
author: Akvile D.

description: Absolutely terrible. You can feel the sass as you open the door...it hits you like a gust of wind. I frequent a few Starbucks in the city for my daily fix (I have a gold card) and this place makes me sad. I'm no Starbucks evangelist..but this was shit. I will not be returning to this store, and I've told all my friends to stay away unless they have been on a 4 day bender and this is the only store thats open. Bitchy Baristas, forgotten orders, and the place was completely dirty (7am on a Thursday). No. Thank. You.
author: Dylan B.

description: Be careful about coming here around 5-7pm weekdays. Service is way slow and even with a line they only have one register up. Prepared to wait a lot longer than usual for a Starbucks.
author: Eric A.

description: All wrong. Got my order wrong 3 times. 3 times. Seriously! And got arsey with me about it!
author: Simon H.

description:
I walked up to Starbucks and contemplated not even attempting to get a coffee.  I had a 9:15am highlight appointment on Maiden Lane, it was 9:00am, and the line was LITERALLY out the door.  Despite the long line, they got me in and out quite quickly!

An added bonus to the experience: free vanilla via coffee samples while waiting in line... Served by a young gentleman who was busting at the seams with compliments *snicker snicker*.  Not a bad way get your morning started, no?
author: Miyako L.

description: Starbucks.  Its the same damed coffee everywhere you go.  This place is busy. Busy like all the time.  Some seating, no plugs.
author: Denise S.

description: Not a lot of seating, and the location itself is pretty untidy.  Location is great for a meet-up, but probably better off going somewhere else. :(
author: Mel G.

description:
I know, I know - Starbuckses are a dime a dozen. That being said, some are better than others, and I think these folks deserve credit for providing great service. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful, and manage to keep up a high level of service despite serving tourists all day every day. This location is open pretty late and the staff seems to know quite a few regulars, which definitely reflects positively on how the store is run. They are the primary reason why I am bothering to review Starbucks (of all places).

Note: this location is ~1.5 blocks from union square, so if you are looking to work (with free wifi!) in a starbucks that doesn't have too much foot traffic, you should definitely go elsewhere. If you're looking to people watch, this would be a great venue for you.
author: Rishi N.

description:
It's sad that a Starbucks took over this location. It's sad that it's always crammed with tourists who could be giving their money to a small business. It's sad that I go there nearly every morning when I'm in the neighborhood, remembering the last place that was there, with its nice Italian coffee bar and delicious breakfasts.

It's yet another busy, understaffed Starbuck's. I wouldn't even be writing this review except after three or four experiences in one regard - I get my latte to the office and start drinking it, and I notice the coffee tastes just like tobacco. This doesn't happen every time, but it does happen.

Starbucks, you are the Two Buck Chuck of coffee.
author: Roxmarie M.

description:
there are more outdoor seating than indoor at this starbucks.

outdoor seating are cold proof but definitely not rain proof.  if your venti extra hot latte is not enough to warm you up they have giant heat lamps hovering over you and you will feel like you've gained some sort of heating superpower that shields you away from the cold.  

i went here twice during my sf trip and both times the service was excellent.  i had tuna panini that were well toasted and when i requested my misto english breakfast tea latte be made completely with milk and no water the barista nailed it.  nothing means more to me than my caffeine well prepared in the morning to start my day off right!
author: Alice C.

description: Can get busy as it was on 6/3.  The staff is highly variable in their level of attentiveness but considering the volume of people that come through here, I can understand why there is variability in service levels and staff attitudes.  Not enough to stop me.  I will go here every time I stay at the Marriott in Union Square.
author: Greg G.

description: Here's a shout out going to Olivia, who helped my sister and I, from ringing us up for our drinks all the way to making them at the bar. Introducing new ideas to personalize our drinks and even giving us a little back story on the remodel of the store, she definitely made us feel that welcoming Starbucks experience. Thank you. (:
author: Aaron G.

description:
I was getting ready to work and I was hungry!  I ordered a Blueberry Streusel Muffin.  This thing looks so amazing like a piece of art and was delicious.  The blueberry was sweet and the muffin was very soft.  It had a unique crust on top that was sweet and when you take a bite with the crust and the muffin it's like heaven! 

It was too early for a cup of Joe, but the nice cashier also asked me if I wanted a cup of water without me asking, very kind and caring I must say.  I was pretty impress!

The only thing I was not happy was that all the seats / tables were taking so I waited until somebody was done.

Overall this Starbucks is at a prime location, if you tired and want something warm to drink this is the spot at the corner!  Friendly staff and you'll get your drink in no time!

-Parking-

Parking? Nowhere close to find any parking during the day, mostly yellow commercial unloading / loading zones.  It's more of a quick pit stop for a drink or the recharge with a cup of Joe or latte!
author: Kenneth Y.

description:
Surprise, surprise, but my first ever review is on Starbucks and for someone who normally doesn't like chain stores, especially a coffee chain in the San Francisco/Bay Area, I've had a change of heart since my move to Chicago. 

The service at this place is great. Its a crazy busy location on the corner of Powell and Sutter, and yet the staff is fast and friendly and can interpret weird requests without messing things up. 

If you're looking for a place to sit down and relax or do some school work, office work etc. again the location hampers this spot. Its actually bigger than I would expect given locale but it is always packed and hard to find a seat. This is more of a get your item/s and go place, but to me coffee places should be set up so that you can sit back and relax so minus a star there. Also minus a star because hey, as far as taste goes I mean common' its the Bay Area, there are so many great coffee places out there.

3 stars - great staff/service, and a little nudge for the iced green tea
author: Kari I.

description: The service here SUCKS!!!! It took me forever to get my drink. These people here move at a snails pace. It took me about 11 minutes to get my drink. I had expressed to them that I had to get back to work. They were talking more than they were working "VERY UNPROFESSIONAL". And to make matters worse, my drink was TERRIBLE.    NEVER EVER EVER AGAIN! If I could give them a minus star I would :-(
author: Monee C.

description:
Yesterday I started out the morning full of confidence and high hopes. It ended with 55 points hung up on my alma mater. I then became a little cranky. Actually truth be told, I was a lot cranky. I decided to bail on my friends and catch a late night flight home back to SFO.

I woke up this morning still feeling cranky and decided it would be best if I just went into the office. Who cares if it was 5:50 in the morning I wasn't going to sleep anyway. 

After just an hour of trying to work I thought about my true love in life---Hot Cocoa--- And I believe now is the time to fill you on my official 2009 hot chocolate ratings. So here you go, your guide to the best (and worst) of hot cocoa 2009.

Starbucks 7 out of 13. A bit heavy and syrupy. The milk flavor is hidden but I have my way of ordering that can greatly improve your experience.

Peets 8 out of 14. A little lighter than it's Starbucks counterpart with a little more froth as well. Careful ordering it "extra hot" because they will.

Specialties 11 out of 15. One of the best kept secrets in the Bay Area. It's almost perfect and reminds of hot cocoa that you would find in Europe. Nice color as well, much like a fine wine.

Swiss Miss 9 out of 16. Yes, these packets of dried up cocoa is underrated. Used best with warm milk, but do not be afraid to mix with hot water as the yummy flavor remains. 

Town Hall 18 out of 20. The best hot chocolate in the City, hands down. If you live within 50 miles of this p;lace, it's worth the drive. Trust me on this.

The vending machine at the Palo Alto Medical Foundation 3 out of 9. It's just piping hot water with a dash of something brown. 

Starbucks (any airport location) 6 out of 14. Yes, your Starbucks experience at the airport is different than what you are used to. This is true.

There you have it. My 2009 ratings of hot cocoa. Feel to print a copy and take it with you and share this guide with your friends.
author: V B.

description:
Can't really rate it since it is a SB I have not
ventured into as I was sorry to see the previous unique coffee shop 
and lunch spot close and a Starbucks replace them. So I go to other
places in the neighborhood for coffee. However, my coworker goes
there now and then and reports it to be about the same as any other SB.
It is better that they not have too much outdoor seating, it is a very
busy corner with a cable car 
and a lot of tourists, the foot traffic has to move quickly.
author: joan b.

description: Poor service. Out of half and half. Long line, poorly marked.
author: Darron R.

description: Great starbucks, very fast and nice loation- just be aware its very busy with toursits
author: Brittainie B.

description:
this review is for all Starbucks in general, not just this location.

i am addicted to their caramel macchiato! my daily Starbucks run is a Grande caramel macchiato with one of their yummy pastries. my breakfast usually cost me between $6-$10. which is a bit much consider i get hungry literally 2 hours later! if im spending $10 on a meal, i'm expecting to be full for a good 4 hours at least! 

all the barista at Starbucks are NEVER consistence with my drink. sometimes its great, sometimes its nasty! if i am going to pay $4 for a coffee i expect it to be GREAT, not just average or sometimes even wayyy below average. i even had one barista told me to get a upside down caramel macchiato next time if the coffee is too bitter for me. excuse me lady, but if you actually made my drink right i wouldn't taste burnt coffee bean in my mouth! 

Starbucks i hate you with a passion, yet i go back everyday to let you suck my hard earn money because my day is not right without a joe of my regular joe from you..!!
author: Jenny G.

description: It's a perfectly normal Starbucks: they've got a good process and the employees here execute on it well. However, if you're looking for a place to settle down for a while, never ever choose this place. It's far too touristy, the volume of traffic means that their wi-fi is terrible, and the music plays very loudly. If you want a quick coffee and snack, this place is good. If you want to get some work done, it's just totally wretched.
author: Brighid M.

description:
Wow, a 27th Starbucks within a half-mile radius around Union Square. Just what we needed!

Well, this new location beat all the other ones.

It's spacious, with lots of comfy seating inside, tall stools facing the windows, and the coolest part, several outside tables for a perfect  tourist-watching sunny afternoon, if you are into that. 

If you are an early freak or a late night Union Square lover, you'll be happy to know that they are opened everyday from 5am to midnight.
author: Margie B.

description:
Yes, I KNOW Starbucks is the generic-o all-purpose stop off for a decent cup of coffee and anyone knows you can run into several on one block in a tourist area like this one.

Why the one star rating then? Because I remember what this was before it was Starbucks. Because it was an awesome, "I feel like I'm in Europe", gorgeous little French cafe/pastisserie. I used to always look forward to coming here - especially on rainy and cold days - ahhhh - it always felt so luxurious, so wonderful....

...unlike Starbucks. 

Impersonal, almost rude service from teenager employees and sitting at a table near gangs of Chinese boys trying to score with the barista....tragic. And don't even get me started on how they took all the gorgeous wood and marble counters out and replaced them with Starbucks issue formica countertops and chalkboards! Aaaaaa! 

I guess the closest I can come to describing it is like I was going to visit an old friend and finding that friend dead. With their head chopped off. And a giant STARBUCKS sign impaling their heart. 

So, so very sad indeed.......
author: Nick R.

description:
Gosh, Starbucks is really popping up everywhere...it's almost like a locust infestation.  I mean, come on there is already one down the street.  So, if I had to pick between this location and the other on Stockton, this one is better and should stay.  The other one should be a nice little cafe with fresh salads for the workers of the area.  Heck, even a McDonald's would be better.

I prefer this location because it is larger and the set up is cozy with more room for the long line.  They also have outdoor seating which is nice for those who enjoy a smoke with their coffee, or just want to relax outdoors.  2 stars just for scoring this corner, but heck they can afford it.

The new and/or transferred staff is superior - 3 more stars.  They move FAST, yet are still able to give each customer personal attention and can make almost any type of twist to your beverage that you request.

The food is fresh and displayed very nicely.  There is no overcooked, lingering food odor here; you will not leave this shop smelling like a french fry.

So, even though it is a Starbucks and they are all regarded the same, I have high hopes this one will be the gem of all other other 20 in the area.
author: Yasmin E.

description:
This was once Caffe Espresso... boy they fooled me when I found myself walking into a Starbucks.
i did one of those things where you walk outside and make sure you are in the right place.
The previous cafe wasn't amazing, but it wasn't Starbucks either.

Starbucks is basically the coffee form of Coca-Cola.

See what it used to be hurr:
http://www.yelp.com/biz/caffe-espresso-san-francisco
author: JAYCE B.

description: The service at this Starbucks is great! It's a very busy location and yet the staff is fast and very friendly.  Considering how busy they are, everytime I come in they greet me by my first name and remember my order.  I am very picky when it comes to my coffee, the staff here never dissapoint me. One thing I don't like about this location is that they have new staff every week.  I like to see familiar faces.
author: Lily N.

description:
SERVICE:
Holy crap. This one opens til 11:30pm. SCORE. 


ATMOSPHERE:
In the heart of tourist central, and the bottom corner of Sir Francis Drake Hotel, this place has a warm mystical air about it, with foreigners speaking in their own languages, grabbing a late night coffee in their respective groups.. almost a warm nostalgic feel of summer camp nights far away from home, in a new foreign place bonding with friends with no care of what's to happen in the following week because you're on vacation with sole focus of exploring and relaxing.. or the feel reminds me of going on holiday to an interesting new place, but seeking refuge in a cafe before venturing back out to a new ravines of the city. Plus the actual physical inside paneling are that of a darker, charming wood, fitting theme of Sir Francis Drake's old ornate antique-like decor and charming ambiance. Not too many seats, a bar seating facing out the windows and maybe few small tables. There's one lonely unisex bathroom, which nicely enough doesn't have a code lock for it! Unusual for downtown bathroom. ;P
author: Angela L.

description: This is a Starbucks location where I seriously will never return. Besides rushing clients to order, having someone shouting out loud your name multiple times, while you are right there to receive your cup, and then having the waiter give me an up/down look...showing some atitude, is not my idea of a relaxing coffee time. I just wanted to run out from that place asap.
author: Betty B.

description:
This starbux is awesum! It's open hours later than every other establishment at Union Square, and on most days it's open 24 hours a day.
The atmosphere makes me happy for 2 reasons: the baristas will randomly start dancing and singing along to the hits on the radio. The baristas are particularly brave when it comes to keeping the establishment free from homeless peepes who come in there and harass customers.  There is nothing like watching a 5"2 gay barista about to b!tch slap  a homeless bum :)
author: Sam S.

description: We were on our way to Bloomingdale and all of the sudden we see Starbucks on the corner "perfect location" we just needed to calm our thirst - we had a Grande White Mocha and a Coconut Cream Frappucino - they got us in and out very quickly.
author: Gigi W.

description:
this starbucks has THEE best staff. we are stuck down here in tourist hell, and ive never seen attitude from one employee. they are always patient and kind with everyone. everyone!

now that i am working in union square again, i was sad to leave a neighborhoody cafe culture, but the staff at this location keeps me coming back. 

thank you guys for making the corner of powell and sutter more tolerable! i look forward to seeing you in the morning!
author: coffeecake j.

description:
This is the first bad experience I have had in Starbucks. Used to be a great location to buy coffee. Then the some of the old staff left. One new staff was a rude teenage girl, long black hair in a pony tail, skinny face, skinny butt, about 18-19 years old.  I also notice every time she is the cashier the line is backed up. 

First she gives a customer the wrong change, $0.10 instead of $10.10 change. She says sorry to him. It's my turn, I walk up and order. She charges me for 2 drinks when I order one. I argue about the price being wrong since I order the same everyday and this was double the cost. She looks at me with a dumb stoned look on her face and says it's the correct charge. I show her the mistake on the receipt. 

By now the line behind me is backed up around the room to the restroom. With the same dumb stoned look on her face(I swear I just wanted to slap her), still doesn't say sorry. Gets her manager to fix it and then still no apology. 

I'm paying with my hard earned cash and what do I get? I get a totally rude and unprofessional experience for my money that's what. I mean sure I buy only about $10 and day of Starbucks drinks, but 365 days in a year that's $3650. And I've been buying for about 5 years now.
author: Keit K.

description: Service is still really friendly here, and this is also a favorite Starbucks of mine.  My boyfriend and I were Christmas shopping in Union Square and we were starving all of the sudden.  As a quick fix, I decided to duck into this Starbucks and check out their sandwiches.  We picked the Grandma's Turkey sandwich and the Prosciutto and Ricotta sandwich (they heated this one for us).  Good choice to stop here as these sandwiches hit the spot along with a couple caramel apple spice drinks!  :)
author: Maile N.

description: I am a huge fan of Starbucks- always have been. I love the service and I love their consistency. SO I am not writing this review to knock Starbucks, BUT this time something went so wrong and I feel like it's worth mentioning. I paid for a white mocha. I left in a rush so I didn't actually taste it until long after I had left the store. By the time I got home I realized it didn't taste quite right. I opened it up and surprise surprise.. I was drinking a hot cup of milk! I've never been more disappointed. I don't know how you can mess up an order so badly.
author: Jenna L.

description: Horrible coffee- the americano I got was like instant espresso with too much hot water. Understaffed and expensive when you see what you're finally getting. Oh and the girl at the register couldn't be bothered with getting my name right so add rude to that. Never again.
author: Lefteris L.

description: Friendly staff. Restroom doesn't require keys. Lots of seats.
author: Jim L.

description:
eh, I try not to hate on Starbucks. I make an effort so that it's not usually my first destination, but sometimes you need coffee and a Starbucks (or three) is the only place in sight.

It's a little disconcerting that Starbucks opened up here, considering they already had a Union Square shop just a block down Sutter, plus at least three more within a two-block radius.... but this one happens to be the closest to my house now. And again, sometimes that's the only thing that matters.

And to this particular location's credit, the staff seems friendly and quicker than your average Starbucks. Not sure how long it'll last, but it's not like you go to Starbucks for the ambiance anyway, right?
author: Chris M.

description: I'm not a big fan of Starbucks Coffee, but it does its job. I come to this Starbucks often because it's the closest coffee to work. The staff here is awesome! They are super friendly, personable, and extremely patient with the English and non-English speaking tourist.
author: sherrie A.

description: This is, without a doubt, the filthiest  Starbucks I've ever seen: From its littered bathroom with no toilet paper, to the disgusting area for sweeteners with out a clean spot on it to set your cup, Avoid this dump!
author: TGirl A.

description: I love the customer service from the 5:30am team...they always have smiles and remember me! Thanx
author: Brandi R.

description: Place is excellent for working, coffee is typical good Starbucks, but I can literally feel the wind blowing under the windows, wow, not comfortable at all. Should think about other window and door designs (not that fancy bu t functional)
author: dogan kaya b.

description:
This is the Starbucks that is technically in the same building as the Sir Francis Drake Hotel.  

Given that the baristas there deal mostly with tourists, I'm not holding them to the same standard as my 490 Brannan crew.  Even if they can't remember my name or my face, I think they could at least try to be a little more personable and a little less transactional.  Like if you're an employee with a scar across your forehead and into his scalp (hopefully not from a customer), maybe don't say "You got a problem?"  Say "Can I help you?"
author: Vose S.

description:
this starbucks is crraaapppy. seriously crappy. 
I usually go to the starbucks right ouside of the powell st. bart station, so i rarely go to this one... The upside to this place is that it opens at 4am... Which is awesome when your doing an overnighter like I have to do every once in a while at my job... so I suppose that since the denomination of people that come in a 4:15 am is about 1/10 of the denomiation of the people that they see at 1:00pm in the afternoon, they have all the crazies working in the morning? because that's what it seems like... there was a line of about 10 people and one cashier and one barista... so, already they loose a star... then i realize that there is one more person back there, great! she's gonna come on and i may actaully get my drink this century... but no, she gets on, and proceeds to open up packages and put away the pastires. when you have a line out the door (no lie, it was out the door) and you can see that your partners are clearly struggling, put down the box of muffins and start making some lattes! that's 2 stars down... then the real kicker... all of a sudden the barista and cashier (which i am fairly certain was the owner) start to YELL at eachother, I mean I thought that they were gonna start to throw some bows! it was crazy and entertaining... but it set them back even further from getting our drinks done... this place is a heapin hot mess!
author: Norma O.

description:
Ok, so I haven't been to a lot of Starbucks (usually drink the free stuff at work), so maybe I don't know how the drill works. But given the fact that a friend of mine worked there for YEARS and she says this one sucks as well, I'm going to go with that as well. 

My main problem with this Starbucks has to do with their Green Tea Lattes. My friends and I ordered them last Sunday and our first clue should have been that the "barista" looked at us like we were on drugs. Anyway, we all ordered tall drinks, however, when they come out she's given us two talls and 1 grande. Fine, whatever. But as we were walking down Powell sipping on our drinks, we realized they tasted weird. They weren't blended properly so, we could totally taste the powder used to make the drink. On top of that, we could see through the transparent cups that all the powder was practically on the bottom of our cups! We would have gone back, but we had to be somewhere else and couldn't spare the time. Not going back to that place again.
author: Monica J.

description: Wow!  I'm finally a lucky American that lives within 6 blocks of a Starbucks!  I've purposely re-routed my walk to work so that I can grab my latte every morning here.  It's a pleasant walk.  The Beefeaters in front of the Sir Francis Drake always nod their heads at me.  If I'm running a few blocks late, the jolly black guy in the pimped out suits in front of Saks belts out a tune in my honor.  But this Starbucks experience is a real buzz kill first thing in the morning.  For as many staff as they usually have behind the counter, it appears to be totally disorganized and the coffee flow is lopsided.  Either there is a massive barrage of people in line placing orders, or there is a massive groupe of people waiting for their drinks.  The majority of the mornings, the counters are a mess and the bins aren't stocked so I have to dig around down below for the packet of pure brown sugar.   I must confess that I come here because I think my odds of bumping into a hot Brit or Frenchie are the best here, but my nerves are getting so frayed that I might have to crawl back to the Bush Street location if they can''t get their beans in order.
author: Amy Z.

description:
never thought I would review a Starbucks....
hands down the nicest, friendliest and most efficient staff of any coffee place I have ever been to.  the location is ideal and the interior is by far the nicest of any Starbucks I've ever been into.
they are also open until midnight.
author: Jaden V.
